As Hill Lake is only a depth of 7 to 8 feet- the disk was in view to the bottom.  A slight yellow tinge to the water.
As the max. depth of Hill Lake is 8 feet- the disk was in view to the bottom.  Slight green tinge to water.
As Hill Lake only has a depth of 7 to 8 feet- the disk was in view to the bottom.  Water had a slight green tinge to it.
As the depth of Hill Lake is 7 to 8 feet- the disk was in view to bottom.  Slight green tinge to water.
As Hill Lake is 7 to 8 feet in depth- the disk was in clear view to the bottom at 7.25 feet.  Water had a slight green tinge.
As Hill Lake only has a depth of 7 to 8 feet- the disk was in clear view to the bottom at 7.30 ft.  Water had a slight green tint.
As Hill Lake is only 7 to 8 feet in depth- the reading of 7.50 ft. is only because it hit bottom at that point.  Disk was in view to bottom.  Slight green tinge to water.
Hill lake is only 7 to 8 feet in depth.  So the Secchi reading was only 7 feet because that was where it hit bottom.  Disk in sight to bottom.
The Lake is low.  Depth of lake at site was only 7 feet.  Disk was in sight to bottom at 7 feet.  Slight green dinge to water
Lake is very low.  Hill Lake generly has a depth of 7 to 8 feet.  The depth now is only 5 1/2 feet.. Disk was in view to the bottom- at that depth.  Water has a slight tinge of gree.
Disk was in view to 6.5 ft.- when it hit bottom.  Depth of lake is normaly 7 to 8 ft. but is low at this time.  Water was clear with a very slight green tinge.
Hill Lake's normal depth is between 7 + 8 ft.  The lake is low at this time so the disk hit bottom at 6.75 ft.  Disk was in view to bottom.  Water had a very slight green tinge.

As Hill Lake is only 7 to 8 feet in depth- that is the readson the Secchi reading is at 7 feet.  The disk was in plain view to the bottom- at 7 feet.  Very slight green tinge to the water.  Weather was cook + overcast.
The depth of Hill Lake is only 7 to 8 feet.  The disk hit bottom at 7 feet and was in view to bottom.  Water had a green tinge to it.
Hill Lake is only 7 to 8 ft. in depth.  This is the reason for the reading of 7 ft.  We hit bottom with the disk in view.  Water had a slight green tinge to it.

column1: For the last two weeks Hill Lake was troubled by a very heavy Algae Bloom.  Since the rain storms this last week-end the Algae has cleared up substantially. Hill Lake only has a depth of 7 to 8 ft.  Disk hit bottom at 7 ft. and was still in view.  It was not the clarity of the water that caused the reading.  Water had a slight green tinge to it.
For the last two weeks Hill Lake  had a problem with a heavy Algae Bloom.  Since the rain storms over the week-end- the Algae is mainly gone on the surface.

column2: Lake is very low.  Water is clear with a slight tinge of green.  Disk in sight to bottom- at 5 feet.  Lake is 2 to 3 feet low.
Weather was partly cloudy.  Disk in view to bottom- at 7 ft.  Slight green tinge to water.  Dwight Pugh also participates.
Weather was clear + sunny.  Lake appeared very nice.
